Defiled Amalgamation

"The skies echo a threatening call..." - When smashing the third [link Defiled Fissure]
[statblock Defiled_Amalgamation]

The Defiled Amalgamation is a [link pre-Hardmode | $default | https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/Pre-Hardmode] boss that resides in the [link Defiled Wastelands]. It can be summoned when the player is on the surface of the world after destroying 3 [link Defiled Fissures] or when the player uses a [link Nerve Impulse Manipulator] anywhere in the Wastelands.
It resembles a bird-like, faintly-humanoid appearance while having two large fang-like appendages on both of its sides. These appendages reduce incoming damage by 65% when attacked from them (80% in Expert, and 100% in Master).

The Defiled Amalgamation has multiple behaviors during its encounter. It dashes at the player, summons spikes, and can regenerate health. These behaviors can be explained in greater detail below.

The Defiled Amalgamation is the only source of the [link Undead Chunk] material and is additionally a method to obtaining usable amounts of [link Lost Ore]. Furthermore, defeating the Amalgamation allows the Tavernkeep to spawn.

Behavior

Approach

When the Amalgamation approaches the player, it will use its appendages to protect itself as it slowly descends to the ground whilst following the player's horizontal position. When close enough, it will drop and prepare to attack the player.

Sidestep

The Defiled Amalgamation will often perform a sidestep to dodge incoming attacks or to move closer to the player.

Attacks

  • Dash Attack - The Amalgamation will attempt to hit the player with a fast dash. It will charge at the player with its appendages swaying to its movement.
  • Uplift Attack - The Defiled Amalgamation will charge an attack where it balls up then proceeds to lift its appendages up, summoning Defiled spike-splosions that expand outward. The "cast" used to spawn them can penetrate tiles and will only explode when nearby the player.
  • Summon Attack - The Amalgamation will spawn [link Defiled Swarmers | $default | Defiled_Swarmer.html] when reaching half of its health to attack the player.
  • Knockout Attack - The Amalgamation's final attack is a triple-dash attack strike, but when it finishes the strike it will rest in place unable to move for 9 seconds (6 seconds in Expert, and 3 seconds in Master).

Special

The Amalgamation additionally has an active regeneration consistent with other Defiled [link Enemies] with a few key differences: the Defiled Amalgamation regenerates in thresholds AND its regeneration rate is flat. Flat regeneration basically means that its regeneration rate does not accelerate from recieved damage. These thresholds are present at every eighth (1/8) of its health (1/6 in expert mode and 1/4 in master mode), and it will regenerate up to these thresholds until its health has been lowered past them.

Difficulty Changes

§Expert§

- In Expert, the Defiled Amalgamation will have reduced health from 2400 to 1920.
- The Amalgamation will attack more frequently as its health drops.
- The Amalgamation's attacks have a 50% chance of inflicting '[link Rasterize]' which will last up to 5 seconds, and still allow the player to attack.
- The appendages on the Amalgamation will reduce incoming damage by 80%.
- The Defiled Amalgamation will only rejuvenate for 6 seconds after performing a Knockout attack instead of 9.
- The Amalgamation will Sidestep more frequently.
- The Defiled Amalgamation will use the Summon Attack at every third of its health.
- Regeneration thresholds will now be divided into quarters.

§Master§

- All Expert changes apply.
- In Master mode, the Defiled Amalgamation will have slightly reduced health from 2400 to 2048.
- The duration of the inflicted '[link Rasterize]' debuff lasts 8 seconds instead.
- The appendages instead block all incoming damage.
- The Defiled Amalgamation will only rejuvenate for 3 seconds after performing a Knockout attack instead of 9.
- Knockout attacks are more frequent.
- The Defiled Amalgamation will use the Summon Attack at every quarter of its health.

Notes

- The Defiled Amalgamation will pursue the player even outside of the Wastelands.
- In Expert, the Defiled Amalgamation will become enraged and attack even more frequently.
- The Amalgamation's behavior is random, rather than using a set order of attacks.

Tips

- The Defiled Amalgamation will not spawn after smashing 3 Defiled Fissures if the player reloads the world.
- Explosives can deal their full damage to the Amalgamation even when attacking the appendages due to splash damage.
- When considering fighting the Defiled Amalgamation, plan ahead and build a proper arena to be above or below it often with platforms laid out in
multiple vertical layers. Be sure to be fast when it rejuvenates from a Knockout attack to deal optimal damage.

Trivia

- Unlike the rest of the world-evils, the Defiled Amalgamation does not have a Hardmode, mechanical equivalent similar to the Brain of Cthulhu.
- Due to its long name, the Defiled Amalgamation is often abbreviated as "DA", and is then occasionally re-lengthened as "District Attorney" or "DeviantArt".

Lore

The Defiled Amalgamation

The Defiled Amalgamation, like all creatures in the Wastelands, was once an ordinary living organism in the world until it was cursed by the Defiled. The
creature that was once the Amalgamation started to go about tasks in the [link Defiled Wastelands] in order to preserve its habitat until it grew to a much larger
size by collecting more chunks overtime and by even absorbing other Defiled beings. The Amalgamation eventually struggled to get any larger as its rate of
decay became more substantial and resorted to maintaining its size by actively hunting anything that comes into its territory. It marks its territory around
the openings of the caverns in the Wastelands and seems to protect the [link Defiled Fissures] as if they were its own. Despite its uniqueness, it too is merely a
proxy of the Defiled.
